description:
Silk Road is quite possibly and very likely the best food I have ever had in a food court. I am used to seeing sad options at a food court and then this one popped up with high ratings and I decided to check it out.

I am not quite sure how to describe this cuisine. It is Asian/Russian themed I guess. They have Russian food like piroshkis, Indian like Pulav and Chinese like dumpling. Doesn't matter where it is from because they were all delicious. Tastes like it is home cooked and healthy. This is their first location and I really hope they do well. Super nice people as well.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I kept passing this place which always drew attention to my olfactory senses via the heavenly aroma of home cooked food in a typical foodcourt that usually smells like cheep pizza and Panda Express. I can smell that old fashioned wholesome scent of something my grandmother used to cook up that always started out by sautéing minced garlic and chopped onions that would always turn into something super delicious, but not of the garlic and onions but the finished product. I was with my niece and we needed to grab a quick bite to eat before her wushu and I asked if she had ever tried a piroshki before and she said no. She's 8 now and I'm running out of things to share with her that remind me of my own childhood. 

I ordered each of us a beef and cheese piroshki thinking 'oh boy she's never tried one before and she's gonna love piroshki's! Well I tried it and it was so dominated by the taste of garlic, microwave heated halfway and the breading very dry and not enough filling that neither of us even finished them. Just tasted awful to me and my niece didn't like it either. I think it even had solid chunks of cooked garlic in it; just gross! The frozen ones at the supermarket taste better! Maybe I'll give this place another try sometime but the piroshki's they have here definitely suck! So two stars for now.
author: David A.

description:
Craving dumplings, I wanted to see if there were any good places to eat nearby. One of the top rated places that showed up on Yelp was Silk Road. 

This kiosk is located inside the foodcourt of Stonetown mall. I arrived a little before 11am and options/stock already seemed to be low. Staff wasn't friendly or very knowledgeable. 

Here's what I ordered:

Napoleon ($4.5): I never had a Napoleon before (nor knew what one was). When I saw it on display, I thought it was a cake with a fancy name (it's not - it's a French pastry...according to Google). This was definitely the highlight of my experience/meal! The layers are super flaky and crunchy and the cream is super tasty (like the cream you find in cream puffs). The powdered sugar on top was a nice touch. 

Chicken Samsa ($3.9): it was okay. Tasted like any normal samosa I've had.  

Potato Piroshki ($3.65): new, cool experience! It's like mashed potato baked/encased into a pastry! Pretty good but my friend mentioned it was too salty. 

Food is actually 6.5/10 but the service and variety took a star away. Came for dumplings, couldn't get dumplings. Overall, good option to try if you're looking for a fast, quick bite.
author: Ida H.

description: Wanted to try their potato piroshki but they were all out! (by 5:30pm) So instead, had their beef and cheese piroshki and a chicken samza. It was pretty good. Will come again to try the other food items!
author: Adrienne L.

description: The employee was busy on her phone took her about 5 minutes to realize there was a line forming. The menu says $4.99 sweet crepes but my total came out to 6.50. Asked for a banana nutella crepe, out of bananas. Ask for a fork, only spoons and knives are left....
author: Guadalupe R.

description:
When they served Uzbek food, this was one of my favorite restaurants in the Bay Area. Now they're a crepe shop. 

I'm super-sad about no longer being able to go here for the plov and the creamy chicken and mushroom dish. Ah, it was amazing... Such amazin food and such great prices. Husband and I told all our friends about this spot.

When Husband and I stopped by this weekend for our beloved Uzbek food, we found Silk Road still existed, but now they serve crepes. I was so heartbroken, I didn't actually try the crepes. The young women working were very polite to me and the crepes looked and smelled divine. I'll probably try one soon, but for now...

I long for plov and the creamy chicken and mushroom dish, and all the other amazing dishes they used to serve. 

So, 5 stars as a memorial to a little food court restaurant that I suspect I'll miss for a long time to come.
author: Marguerite C.

description:
I love trying food from different cultures and countries so the fact that this place serves authentic Uzbek cuisine was a complete draw for me. I had the Chicken in Tomato Sauce with the plov, tomato salad, and coleslaw as sides. Everything was full of rich and delicious flavors. One thing to note is I came here quite hungry for a late dinner on a Sunday after doing a bit of hiking in Lands End and walking in the Richmond/Sunset neighborhoods so the food wasn't as fresh and a number of the entrees were sold out.   

PLOV
While the plov was hearty and oh so savory, the rice was a bit hard and some parts of it were tough to chew. I need to eat here earlier next time to try a fresh batch! My mom has some Chinese recipes that are either influenced heavily by Central Asian cuisine or may just be Central Asian in origin and this reminded me of one of her rice dishes and of eating at home. 

CHICKEN IN TOMATO SAUCE
I could tell the chicken was stewed for a long time. The flavors had seeped into the meat and the meat came easily off the bones. I had to ask for some of the tasty soup that the chicken was cooked in and was given a small ladle of it. The to-go container was not ideal for carrying soup but what a dilemma because I would have hated to use up another container.
author: Lauren H.

description:
My anticipation to eat here finally came true today with 3 bucks for a big beef dumpling...
It took a while to get my order (I think the dumplings werent as popular?) but it came in 5 minutes. Not bad.
The big dumpling itself had a stellar wrapping, but just a little about average beef filling. I thought it'd come out with sour cream, but it was served with hot sauce (didnt take it when offered).
For 3 bucks, it was mentally and physically filling enough to come back again. Though I'll try getting the kompot, plov, borsht, lagman, the other dishes that seem similar to Burmese & Indian food...
Great alternative to the 382957 other 'typical' Asian places in Stonestown (cough Marugame cough)
author: Timmy C.

description:
There's still so much I can expect from Russia when it comes to food.  What really familiarize the food is taste.  I know I haven't come across the potato dumplings, but the only ones I successfully tried are piroshki and borscht.

Here in Stonestown food court, while my family went into separate fast food arcades, I headed to Silk Road.  There, I bought and tried the Lagman Noodle Soup.  Not bad!  I might come to the same place to see what else I can try.  Customer service is absolutely fair with a smile.
author: Jimmy C.

description: The place is huge and welcoming. Their rice and lamb shank dish is the best. I highly recommend
author: Daniel G.

description: I was misguided by its high yelp reviews! The udon close to it has even less stars but has a 30 min wait, so that tells you something. Totally overpriced and mediocre. The mall setting gives it one extra star. The fried rice was ok but nothing impressive. The lamb was good but you only got 1-2 small pieces.   Not worth going.
author: Minxuan H.

description:
This review is only for their meat pies.  During the time I visited they were only selling pies and either piroshki or Napoleon slices.  I know they used to serve hot food, but on this day I'm not sure if they have stopped doing so or if it was just a one-off.

Anyway, the pies are a bit pricey at $3.95 each for a small square portion.  They were fresh as the clerk had just brought out some from their oven.  I chose the chicken and the beef pies.  To be honest, the crust was lovely-very flaky and rich-but the fillings could be better.  The chicken was like pretty shredded and pasty but had a good flavor.  The beef, however, I am certain they added lamb to it as it tasted a bit gamey.  It was okay, but I don't care for lamb so it was a bit disappointing.  And a couple pieces of meat were hard and gristly.
author: Luisa T.

description:
Decided to try this place out because it looked interesting and is different from the other food court restaurants. Also, I have not seen Russian/Asian fusion food. 

Got the 2-item meal and it was underwhelming. The meal I got came with some rice, one drumstick, and two small meatballs. The meatballs were very small. It also did not come with a drink. 

Good trying it once, but I would not come back considering all the other restaurants in Stonestown.
author: U L.

description:
I've been meaning to try Silk Road based on a friend's recommendation (he's Kazakh and the food here is Russian/Uzbek) and so I stopped by to try something small. 

I picked up a chicken samsa ($3ish) which is basically a handpie with a flakey pastry crust and filled with chicken, onions, and a mix of spices. I thought it was a little salty for my taste, but it was very flavorful and delicious!

I'll come back to try more food -- especially the Napolean cake.
author: Sofia R.

description:
This is the real deal for some of the amazing cuisine to be found along the Silk Road!  The chef hails from Uzbekistan and definitely knows what he is doing.

My husband is an ethnic Russian from Tashkent.  He is not a fan of most of Russian cuisine but became very excited when he tasted the Plov (Uzbeki pilaf). The Chicken was also very good as was the Lamb with Potatoes!  Don't forget the fresh salads--one a Cole slaw type and the other with tomatoes and onions.

I need to learn all the names of this food that makes my taste buds so happy!

Don't tell anyone, but we will be back tomorrow buying the food for the "home cooked" dinner we are serving a few friends.  ;)

Can't wait to return and try the beef, the chicken with mushrooms ...
author: Miriam S.

description: The customer service is not good.  The food is very mediocre and providing very little good food options
author: Alla Y.

description:
I stopped by today after months of not getting food there (because now that I am diabetic, I avoid rice). My favorite there is the chicken dish and the lamb and potatoes. I always have these two with their special rice and the tomato salad. My total favorite!! This is exactly what I was hankering for when I approached their stall.

Lo and behold, the dishes were different! No chicken, the lamb is now beef, and the rice dish is now plain white rice with green peas. And now, their combo meal doesn't come with a salad. And the tomato salad is altogether absent.

With that said, I went ahead and ordered the two item combo. I got tiny servings of the beef and potatoes and this creamy mushroomy dish with pork (I think). And after being told that they changed their menu and that salad is no longer free, I ordered the carrot salad.

All in all, disappointed. Did the combo get cheaper? Is that why the servings are too small?

Am sad. I loved your delicious and generous portions :-(
author: Jun Q.

description:
My first job ever was at Macy's in Stonestown.

On my first day, my 20-something year old manager called in "sick" (read: hungover) and I was left to my own devices at the mattress department.

Male customer: "Hi, I'm looking for a new mattress for my wife and I." 
Me: "Please feel free to test out any of the mattresses and let me know if you have any questions."

*Male customer crawls onto a Serta Perfect Sleeper on ALL fours and starts shaking the bed*

Male customer: "This mattress seems really sturdy...do you think it's sturdy enough for my wife and I?"

*Male customer holds headboard while on ALL fours and shakes the bed again*

Male Customer: "You see, we broke the springs on our last mattress."
Me: "YEEEEAAAAAA, I BET..."

Working in the mattress department, I wish I could un-see some of the things I've seen but at least it was entertaining.  

One thing I always looked forward to was my lunch break and paying a visit to the food court at Stonestown. Sorabol, Panda Express, and California Crisp - FTW! Hey, I was in high school then and had zero standards when it came to food. The last several years when I tried the food again at my [former] top 3 food court places, it was terrible. No wonder food courts get such a bad rep these days.

I saw Silk Road listed as a "hot and new" business on yelp and it piqued my interest (even though it's in the food court at Stonestown) as I've never tried Central Asian Cuisine before. In fact, I think Silk Road is the first semi brick and mortar to serve Central Asian Cuisine in SF (aside from a Uyghur Taamliri, a pop-up at Chug Pub). 

On the menu is Manti (Beef Dumplings), Lamb & Potatoes, Roasted Chicken, Lagman (noodle stew?), Chicken in cream sauce, Plov (rice pilaf), Noodles, and Mashed Potatoes. Choose 2 entrees & 1 side: $8.75 or 1 entrée & 1 side for $6 (mini meal). They also sell piroshki, samba (beef "hot pocket"), and pastries.

My friend ordered a mini meal for me of the Lamb & Potatoes w/ plov ($6): http://bit.ly/26f4JQn. Central Asian homestyle, comfort food was the best way to describe my meal. The rice pilaf (plov) was aromatic, flavorful, and delicious but a bit on the oily side. The lamb & potaoes (kuurdak?) tastes very home cooked which I appreciated but the lamb was really tough and the potatoes were a bit undercooked. A small side of what looked to be pico de gallo was provided which needed more acid. 

I also tried a bite of the Baked Potato Piroshki ($3.25) and I would never order it again: http://bit.ly/1STNYjD. The potato filling was incredibly salty and the bun was hard (didn't taste fresh). We ended up tossing this after several bites. 

For the price, my mini meal was filling and the plov hit the spot. Silk Road has only been for less than 2 months so they can only get better. I'll definitely be back for more of that plov. Just don't tell me how much fat, oil, and/or butter is in it. Sometimes ignorance is bliss...
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Salaams - I came here because it's one of the few places in the area that offers Halal meat. Service is decent but they didn't seem knowledgeable about food items. I forget the exact names but I got a cream and chicken entree that tasted like a tikka masala sauce except less spicy and more thicker, creamy sauce. Second entree was beef and veggies. The beef didn't have much flavor but there was a mild, spicy sauce on the veggies. The rice with carrots pilaf was good. I also had a beef samosa which was good. It was with onions in a thick beef sauce. I like it was different than the Indian and middle eastern samosas I've had. Overall I think the food was good. We are in a mall so don't expect 5 stars. I also think if it was fresh it'd be better. The food that I had had been sitting there for some time. I would recommend this place and I will go back, inshallah.
author: Wallace A.

description:
It's so refreshing to see something besides typical fast food chains at a mall food court.  Central Asian food is quite rare in San Francisco.  Heck, regular old Russian food is hard to come by.  So having this gem at Stonestown gives a reason to eat at the food court.  Some of the dishes really stood out while others were kinda bland.  I was very close to giving a 4-star, but both my mains had extremely measly portions of meat.

Central Asian Style Lamb & Potatoes: The lamb was firm and gamy.  The potatoes were a bit bland.  Unfortunately there were more potatoes than lamb.  Felt like an Indian dish, but with less spice.

Chicken in Creme Sauce: The creme sauce was amazing!  So rich and so tasty.  Unfortunately they were very stingy with the chicken, like only 5 little strips.  A bunch of mushrooms though.

Plov: Basically a rice pilaf that is heavy on the carrots.  Seemed more exciting that plain rice.

Cabbage: Meh, just lightly pickled cabbage in vinegar.  Helped cut the richness of the chicken in creme sauce.

Beef Samsa: Dumpling filling inside of a flaky baked bun.  Actually tastier than the regular dumpling.

Dumpling: An oversized dumpling filled with beef chunks.  Loved that it's served with sour cream, since that's creamier than soy sauce and vinegar.
author: Adam B.

description: The best Napoleon!  I also love their piroshkis.  It's a family-owned biz, and the younger brother of the owner is super nice - he put his good faith in me one night when he'd closed out the cash register, when I wanted to purchase a slice of the Napoleon; he handed me my dessert and told me to take it and pay him back next time when I'd be in the mall.  He'd only had met me once before.  It's really touching to know there still are good-hearted, trusting folks in this world.  Good people like him deserve goodnesses, so go support his business!
author: J L.

description:
This food stand stuck out to me because it's literally in the center of the food court. I actually think it's placement is perfect, since there aren't any restaurants next door to them.

-Although the chicken looked really dry on the inside (white meat), it didn't taste as bad as I thought it'd be.

-The menu is really simple and easy to understand.

I wanted to try their beef piroshki, but they were out. The plov (rice) was oily and buttery, just the way it's supposed to be, I'm presuming. The lamb and potatoes were different, but in a good way. The best part of the meal was the fact that I didn't feel bloated after eating foods with these types of textures and ingredients.
author: Erica K.

description:
The awkward moment has come where I want to write a review for a mall restaurant. 

This isn't your average greasy/fast Panda Express spot nor is it some lackluster BBQ/pizza/chocolate chip cookie joint. Instead, this is the place I crave and want to take a trip to the mall for/to get dinner. Awkward, yes....

This authentic Russian/Uzbek food has plov and lamb/potatoes almost as good as my mom's and the Napolean cake is not to be missed. 

Since trying this spot nearly a month ago, I've been back three times. I can't get enough of the flavorful, fresh good food. I'm hooked and super recommend this little, but mighty delicious spot.
author: Irina R.

description:
This place is great for Authentic Uzbek and Russian cuisine

Located smack in the middle of the Stonestown Galleria Mall food court (2nd floor)

Manty are absolutely delicious and original!
The nearest place like this would be in Los Angeles 

Absolutely recommend them for Lunch or Dinner.
author: Andy M.

description:
i am totally amazed by the reviews on this restaurant.
The food is salty, tasteless and boring.
I guess I should really stay away from food courts, they are all terrible.
author: Siavash S.

description:
I don't understand why people keep passing up on this place. Perhaps they need to consider a better marketing plan to bring in more customers! Whether that would be giving out free samples or promoting weekday specials. Something needs to change. 

The food is awesome and the price is affordable!! The cuisine if definitely different than your typical "mall food", but keep an open mind and explore a new taste. I say give it a try and order the mini meal, because the portion was just right!!

Support this business, because It would be a shame to see this place close down.
author: Briana H.

description: So yummy! The beef with vegetables and plov are great- tastes like a home cooked meal! Their napoleons are delicious too!
author: Liz E.

description: This is the best mall food I've ever eaten. Normally you eat food at the mall because it's convenient. You don't go home and miss it. This is the first time that I've missed a mall food. It really is amazing. I ordered the lamb and potatoes (best dish) with rice, chicken and tomato salad. Everything was cooked perfectly and the flavors surpassed my expectations. I live in San Jose and have been considering driving to SF just to eat here. Sometimes I eat at an expensive restaurant and I think "This food is not worth this price." Honestly, when I ate here I thought "Why isn't this more expensive??" which sounds ridiculous but this this food really is high quality. They should have their own restaurant.
author: Anna T.

description:
SIlk Road is Central Asian Food. it's in a food kiosk away from the main food court. didn't see a kitchen, just a steam table and casings holding prioshki, dumplings, pastries.

nobody was in line when i ordered. only one person appear there the whole time i was eating.

eats: 2 mains, side, and a salad(8.95)
-lagman (beef) was chewy/tuff, small portion, had some kind of sauce
-"Asian style lamb w/potato"-lamb chewy/tuff, small portion, potato ok, curry taste,
-mashed potato side definitely freshly made, not from powder et al.
-tomato salad tasty, very small portion.

take outs:
-mains rate a 2 for poor value/poor food prep.
-mashed potato, tomato salad were hits.
-roasted chicken couldn't be worst than the lamb or lagman. would try that if i ate here again.
author: Victor G.

description: Me and my friend stopped by this place it was my first time here but I am so surprised  taste of the food it is so delicious. Prices are affordable not too expensive. I would recommend to everyone. Thank you guys
author: Georgii S.

description: What a random location for some great russian / asian food! We ordered the borscht and the beef pastry both of which were delicious. Unfortunately they were sold out of the beef dumplings so we will have to go back another time to try those.
author: Alice H.

description:
Recommended by a relative who immigrated to the US when she was 10 from Russia (her family is from Uzbekistan) who said she was shocked to find such authentic, good Central Asian food in a mall food court in San Francisco. I tried it recently (had the beef atop plov, with the shredded carrot salad) and really enjoyed it. Good sized portions.

I didn't know that the beef would come cold/room temperature, so I brought it back to the counter after my first bite. The cook patiently explained it was supposed to be served that way and gave me a sample of the warmed beef to try - he was right, it was better cold! The shredded carrot salad was particularly delicious - sweet, crunchy, and well seasoned.

Looking forward to trying this again the next time I'm at Stonestown.
author: Marisa L.

description: Wow. I have never been impressed with mall food but there is a first for everything! Had the lamb and potatoes with plov and everything was perfect! Very homey food and good value to boot.
author: Don L.

description:
Completely unimpressed. Meat was partly cold, partly warm. Rice was flavorless. Piroshki was "eh" at best, pastry was dry and filling unexciting.

Neither one of us were able to finish our lunch, and it was not because of the large portions.

It really was terrible.

Service was not exactly sparking - he decided we were having "mini meals" - he did not ask or give an opening to tell him differently.

That combined with low food quality means I'll never go back, even if I'm in the mall.
author: R H.

description: Went to the mall after school and found this gem of a place!! Great taste and variety of authentic Slavic food, great prices too!! Will be back to eat some more!!
author: Alex G.

description: Central Asian food at a food court? Yes! This counter/kiosk restaurant is totally unexpected but offers a really interesting option for diners at Stonestown. Not familiar with Central Asian food? Everything is laid out on the counter (Chipotle-style) and you simply go through to pick your sides, entrees, or pastries. I got the regular meal, which comes with two mains and a side. For my side, I had the plov, which was a spiced rice dish with carrots and beef and very heavy on the cumin flavor. It was slightly oily but nicely spiced, and the grains of rice were perfectly al dente in the center. For the entrees, I got the stuffed bell pepper (filled with a mixture of rice and ground beef) and the central Asian lamb and potato stew. Both of these were decent, though the stuffed pepper felt a little greasy and the lamb was a little bit tough (not the greatest quality meat). Nevertheless, this made for a value meal, and while I wouldn't be in a rush to return, I'd recommend Silk Road for something unusual to try at Stonestown.
author: David K.

description:
This place is pretty good compared to the usual food that the mall has to offer. Prices are reasonable, $8 for a mini plate and a side dumpling. Portions were good but was a bit heavy on the rice. I would've appreciated more salad over the rice though (tomatoes salad is yummy). The flavors here are closely similar to a rich, buttery, hearty feel. Would come again.

This place is new and although it was super clean, I can't really rate cleanliness yet.
author: Ernest L.

description: Pretty good for mall food. Not many choices at the stonestown food court and this is probably the most unique out of them. Minimeal was good and cheap. I came late so there wasnt much food left though, got side of rice and lamb and potatoes entree. Better than getting panda all the time and cheaper than the other restaurants here.
author: Kalima Z.

description: I've spent a lot more of my life than I'd care to admit eating at the Stonestown food court, and I've never seen anything this high quality there before. This is great Central Eurasian comfort food; lamb and potatoes is my favorite entree, and plov is a great side for it. A hidden jewel of hearty, delicious food in the Stonestown food court.
author: AJ P.

description: My boyfriends and mine lunch spot after some shopping! We are both very familiar with Central Asian cuisine as I am from Russia and he is Kyrgyz. Silk Road's plov is really good, their chicken cutlet is exactly as my grandma would make it. All food definitely tastes 'home-made'! Ah, and don't forget to try their 'manti' aka beef dumplings, they serve it with 'smetana' aka sour cream- ridiculously good!
author: Kira U.

description:
Hidden find. Best piroshki in the city. Everything is so yummy -- meats are slow cooked amazing.

And yes it is in the food court of a mall.
author: susie w.

description: I had the Borscht soup and it was quite well done! Very tasty and comparable to being in Russia. :) Also had the potato piroshki which was a nice side combo. Ingredients seem fresh!
author: xmarksthespot y.

description: This place offers the best home made taste to food that you can find at Stonestown! Its always on point and they are always friendly and up to service. I would recommend this place to anyone at anytime. Thank you people for the amazing food
author: Alec E.

description: Great food, I like a lot the central Asian beef . Plot (rice with carrots are delicious!
author: Ben Aasf S.

description: Wow. What a surprising gem in the middle of the mall! Loved the potato peroshkie - delightfully soft, flaky, and tasty. Yum. I wish I had gotten another one.
author: Ll W.

description:
I'm a sucker for mall food (see some of my other reviews for examples!).  I'd had Silk Road previously and it was "alright".  However, I was in a bit of a rush Saturday afternoon and since there was no wait, I gave them a try again.  i had the rice, Central Beef / Potatoes, and a Chicken Cutlet + Chicken Samsa. 

Upon a second helping, the food was tasty though the Cutlet needs a knife to eat properly.  The Samsa is a bit salty but I finished it in no time.  The reason mall food gets a bad rap is that it's generally a variation of burgers, Asian, Mexican or Italian.  Silk Road is a good alternative to the options at Stonestown.  Give the folks some business as their food is a different taste but in a good way.
author: Donald L.

description: Friendly service, no line, yummy pilaf, homey tomato chicken and cream of chicken w/ mushrooms... YAS!  Kind of want to keep this place on the down low so I can just hop in and out with my meal.  $10 is not horrible for a 2 entrée, 1 side meal.  And it comes with a small salad/tomatoes+onions.
author: Janet T.

description: Their savory pastries are to die for. I had the beef Samsa and the spinach and mushroom piroshki, both were amazing. Both were well seasoned, not the slightest bit lacking in spices, herbs or flavor. Perfect snack for a break between shopping that isn't the usual greasy, overpriced junk food.
author: Janit S.

description: Me and my friends were looking for central asian cuisine, We found this place, I thought it would be ordinary mall food, but that was really good, I loved this place, portions were big, and prices are acceptable, I really recommend this place
author: Aiperi N.

description: How exciting to find a russian/Uzbekistan food place in the middle of the mall! I've forgotten the names but do try the chicken that's stewed in tomato sauce, it's delightful, and instead of choosing white rice choose their other seasoned rice, it's so flavorful. Those are my top two recommendations, but regardless of what you choose it'll be yummy. They offer ridiculous portions to fuel your long day of shopping!
author: Larissa L.

description: I grab a mini meal at Silk Road twice or more a week, and I've yet to feel disatisfied with the food there. There is never a long line so I don't have to spend more time than I need to at that food court. I am going to keep my fingers crossed that this place stays open, because I really don't want to look for another go-to lunch spot.
author: Tyrone V.

description:
I am Russian and I love Central Asian food. 
Silky Road is my new favorite snack place at stones town - no more pretzel bites. 
Their samsa is delicious and very fresh. 
My grandma makes piroshki on every occasion. And let me tell you, their piroshki are not worse than my grandma's (my grandma is a pro). Very traditional/authentic and very fresh. 
I recommend this place if you are at stones town.
author: Jenna F.

description:
this is my FAVORITE place to eat at the mall 
they have an amazing flavored rice (it's like fried rice on steroids) and an amazing lamb and potatoes and also this picked cabbage salad. I think if I got the lamb and potatoes with plain rice it would be GF but i'm not 100% sure. it's like home cooked food. 

They also have yummy beef and chicken pastries (kid got a beef one and gobbled it down with no complaints). the guys that worked there have consistently been SO friendly and really funny. My kid LOVED them (and btw he loved their food too - including half my food!) - the guys there joked around with him and made him feel so special. 

we love Silk Road and we will be back next time we go to the mall!
author: Win H.

description: I must've eaten here once a week this summer... the people who work here think I work at the mall since I go here so much. But no, I actually go out of my way to go to Stonestown and eat here. Not sure why it took me so long to write a review. Everytime I come here, there is no line, which is great. But I feel like everyone is missing out on this hidden gem. This is the first place that I've tried central Asian food... and it's AMAZING. I always wonder if this is food court food and already tastes this great, I definitely need to try more. Anyway, I always get the same thing: the plov, roasted chicken in tomato & lagman. Everything has so. much. flavor. It also comes with your choice of salad too. And all for just under $10... you really can't beat that.
author: J K.

description:
Omg! Omg! I am a fan!

Service: 5 stars. The girl at the counter was super helpful in helping select what I should try.it was my first time eating central Asian food, and I am now a fan!

Food: 5 stars. I loved loved the pulov! Very flavorful - I rarely say that about rice. The beef side was a great compliment. The chicken in tomato sauce is super flavorful and nice. The lamb and potato was the only downside - it was good but imho it needed more salt. Have the pulov with the onion and tomato salad. 

I need to come back to try the samsas. Huge portions - so unless you have the outdoor lifestyle of Genghis Khan, this is a huge meal!
author: Anwar H.

description:
Delicious! I know that central Asian cuisine sounds intimidating but believe me, it's not! Think of it as food you normally get but with the flavors enhanced and amped up!

The mini meal is actually quite large and you get an entree, side, and salad that gives you the best of all worlds. The side is a grain (rice or noodles) followed by your meaty entree, and a crisp and tart salad. I recommend the plov+breaded chicken cutlet+ tomato salad combo--a perfect combination of texture and flavor. Think about it: would you rather get this or the run-of-the-mill rice/orange chicken combo you'd normally get at the mall?

**Also ask for the cream sauce atop your chicken cutlet; it adds a whole new creamy dimension to the dish**

I am super impressed and the staff is great as well! Give it a try if you haven't already and you'll see what I mean by its food that you're used to, but far far better :)
author: Brittany L.

description:
Being  central Asian myself, I've missed my traditional food. Silk Road offers best central Asian food. Yes, rice must be oily, chicken cutlets must be dry, and dumplings must be oversize and filled with lamb/beef with onion, this is how it suppose to be. 

The food at Silk Road is delicious and fresh at reasonable prices. 
The staff is very sweet and answers all your questions if you've never tried this type of food. 

I often stop by to have my lunch between my school and work. 

I would highly recommend this place to try out. 
P. S. Try their fresh homemade style compot. My favorite organic drink made with dry fruits and berries.
author: Bakulia K.

description:
My favorite kitchen! You won't find better Central Asian, Russian, Kyrgyz and Uzbek cuisine in the bay area but this place (Silk Road). Their Samsa (samosa) especially chicken, is so delicious and juicy, I always order more than I could eat, can't resist the temptation. Definitely would recommend to try Pilav and Manty. And the owner is awesome guy, always hooks me up with extra scoop whatever I order. 

Check this place out, you won't regret!!!
author: Azamat S.

description:
Guys are offering very interesting cuisine in a beautiful food court of Stonestown mall ! 

I've personally seen that founder of these place while he was working there as a cashier. He was really polite and nice ! 

Please try some chicken and their beef stew and order one samose or manti (dumplings) !
author: Jay M.

description: Stopped by on a very busy Saturday at the Stonestown food court. Was in the area at least 20 minutes and no one stopped by this place. I came in specifically to eat here and chose the long ass line at Panda instead. The food looks like it might have been yummy at noon but at 4 pm there was nothing that looked edible. Very disappointed
author: Di S.

description: Can I give this place more than five stars?! Service was so nice and the food is so delicious. Make sure to ask if you want then to explain any of their dishes. The food is so fresh and authentic. Take a break from the same old stuff at the food court. Your palate will thank you!
author: Adam C.

description: Recommended by a friend and their food was great and sumptous.The shredded carrot salad was flavourful. I will difinitely come back here and try some other foods.
author: Team M S.

description: Very delicious and authentic Central Asian food. Owner is from Kyrgyzstan. The dumpling is the most delicious thing I've had and that's including Ding Tai Feng in Taipei
author: Anna L.

description: Large portions and great food! I got the regular meal which was 2 entrees and a side, but probably could've been good with the mini meal (1 entree and a side) because the portions were so large. I got the Lamb & Potatoes, Central Asian Beef, and plov. Everything was delicious. My favorite dish was the lamb and potatoes. The lamb was very tender and super flavorful. The beef was a bit on the tough side, but still good. Overall a great food court find for a really good price.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Everything is so delicious! I can live and eat always here, lol. My best things is plov and samsy! You really need to try it! They also have a really good desserts in the city! Those éclairs are so perfect, and Napoleon cake... Come and try! Recommended!!!
author: Dana D.

description: I really liked it. The food was tasty, and the person who helped me was nice. I would recommend it. The only thing off was the beef samsa... Idk but my mom makes them so much better lol . Btw I got the chicken with mashed potato as a side and one beef samsa . Come check it out, it truly is central Asian food.
author: Ester U.

description: Found that place by mistake, great service, very good authentic food. The meat pockets are the best. Defiantly recommended.
author: Maytal S.

description: Tasty, large portions, and excellent service (free water!). The beef dumplings are really good as was the lamb and potatoes. Only complaint is that the sectioned take-away containers are a pain and make it difficult to eat the saucy stuff with the plov. It would be easier if they just put it all on a plate for people eating at the food court. But the food itself was good.
author: Mary S.

description:
The food is absolutely delicious, I stuck with Asian style beef and fried rice! Portions are great for a reasonable "mall" price. 
You guys are the best place in the city with Authentic Kyrgyz food!!!
author: Sabina M.

description: My favorite place. From the very first visit I was really surprised to find everything so delicious!! Every time I go there I enjoy this food! It's healthy and tasty for such a small price. Special thanks to the staff! So friendly and helpful. Definitely I will recommend this place to my friends!
author: Yevgeniya O.

description: Silk Road one of my favorite places to come and have eating all the time.Plov is very good,Somsa is very delicious,staffed bell peppers with melted cheese is so delicious. I recommend anyone to go and try it.
author: Anvar A.

description: Typically, I will do my best not to eat in a foodcourt.  However, since I am working this weekend, I decided to drop by for a quick late lunch.  Ordered the Plov, chicken with tomatoes and tomato salad.  It was really yummy.  So good that I ordered 2 additional dish and the tomato salad for dinner.
author: Susan M.

description: Delicious central Asian food in the Stownstown Galleria food court!! Clean setup, friendly servers, and most importantly, everything was so good! Highly recommended!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Both the lamb and potatoes and the beef lagman were delicious. Would come back to the mall just to eat them. Super friendly too.
author: Tim M.

description: The Central Asian and Russian Food was very delicious! Definately coming back! Thank you!
author: Urie W.

description: I love pastas! The carbonara is great with mushrooms and chicken. Its a little pricey but its all good. Last time i tried it, they have fried chicken as well.. The servers needs to have a little bit of customer service training.. In my 3 visits, 3 different servers attended me and im not satisfied the way they treat their customers.. They are rushing people to order.. But this place is a must try..
author: Ar-ef F.

description: The food is decent but they really skimp on the food now. I ordered one regular plate and one small plate. The regular came with mushroom chicken and a leg and thigh. The chic didn't even fill up the plate with rice and only gave two small scoops of mushroom chicken. For the small plate she only gave me a cup of salad.... Like seriously? I know I am dieting but I need more than 1 lettuce leaf. This isn't the first time this has happened either. For 17 bucks I would rather cook at home.
author: Anjelica R.

description: Mm! I wanted a snack while I was at the mall and ordered the spinach and mushroom Piroshky. Could have used some hot sauce but the inside was moist and really tasty. Fast and attentive staff. I will be returning if I need another snack while shopping
author: Elaine L.

description: Are you kidding me?!! I can't believe that there is not a line at this place! The food is so good and fresh and nobody was there, meanwhile a huge line and the other Asian fast food place. I don't get it. This is like real, good food in the middle of a mall food court! You need to try it!!
author: Jo J.

description: The beef dumpling are super tasty and delicious!!
author: Tigran T.

description: Awesome that this is here!  Had the chicken   cutlet, rice, and carrot salad, I loved it!
author: Jess C.

description:
I was a little shocked when I saw this 4.5 strap lace was in a food court but their dumplings are legit. Also their rice was very tasty and piroshki was average. 

I was impressed that for a place in a food court that their beef was tender and moist.
author: Brice P.

description: Best place for a hefty, good quality meal in the mall. Piroshkis are made fresh here, I can see the chef hand-pressing squares of fresh dough with meat filling. Ordered the regular meal. Comes with two entrées and one side, plus a salad. I recommend the chicken and mushrooms in cream, beef, and plov (rice stewed with carrots). The tomato salad was also very good and fresh. Try the beef dumpling! It was flavorful and made to order. Will be back :)
author: Liz L.

description: Pretty amazing russian food, tastes extremely fresh not like the stuff sitting out on the counter at most of the Russian stores on SF.
author: Dmitriy V.

description: Delicious and flavorful! Love the rice and their tender roasted chicken! I'm sure I will be back again very soon!
author: Yi-Chen H.

description: This place is like a hidden gem! The food is so good! It's freshly made every single day and I can taste it in the food. I drove all the way from San Jose and it was totally worth it. It's inside the mall of the food court but it's its own food stand. This place needs their own restaurant location. Their beef samsa is delicious! Their drink Kompot is healthy and sweet, it's so good. Everything there taste great! I love how fresh it is. I would give it a 6 star rating. I'll be back soon again with my fiance.
author: Hong P.

description: We went after five and the food definitely didn't look fresh--like it had been sitting out all day. The lamb was dried chunks and my sister got one measly piece among a ton of potatoes, and I got three small, shriveled pieces. They only had one chicken cutlet left, so we didn't touch it. The chicken with tomato broth was pretty good, and the pilaf and noodles were so-so. THe food sitting out in the buffet trays weren't very hot. Carrot salad was good and they gave huge portions of the spaghetti, which I thought was good, but my sister didn't like.
author: Clare C.

description: I enjoyed their manty, as well as mashed potatoes with chicken cutlety. Great service!
author: Vadzim M.

description: If your like me and initially was hesitant try it, just do it! The food is delicious. I came with my mom and tried the roasted chicken, beef and veggies, piroshki and delicious rice. Super friendly staff, worth the adventure to the Silk Road.
author: Rosendo A.

description: If you wanna eat central asian food this is one of the best places to go in the city. I woud recommend to try their plov and samsy.
author: Aman E.

description: Super delicious!!! U gotta understand the taste and know how to eat it! It's the only authentic place in the whole bay area and feel really lucky when i go there cause the taste takes me backhome!!! Thank u guys, u are awesome:)))
author: Nafis O.

description: For this price it's really good food. I'm living close to this place and now I got opportunity to come here and eat good home food. Thanks guys! Highly recommend lamb&potatoes,chicken frikase with makarony or mashed potatoes!
author: Vadim R.

description: Delicious! My fiance and I are very glad we stopped by the Silk Road while at the mall. If you love trying new cusine and have an appreciation for authentic, cultural, freshly made food, this is definitely the place for you. We had lamb and potatoes, plov (pilaf in other cultures), noodles, chicken, samsas and I am now craving for more! We also tried what's called Kompot which is a freshly made fruit punch, haven't had anything like this anywhere else. Customer service was very pleasant, the place is clean and the best part is that we have never seen any other Central Asian restaurants in the bay area. If you have never had Central Asian food, this is a must!
author: Ellie B.

description: 5 star mall food.  Large portions and nice customer service.  Food is tasty.  Always get rice with beef and potato with tomato salad.  Yum! Wished more people would give this place a try.  Sometimes it looks like food in the trays have been sitting in there for a while which can look unappetizing.
author: J W.

description: Very nice Central Asian and Russian food. Nice piroshki, plov, kyrgyz dumplings! They take catering orders as well
author: Bektur T.

description: One of the delicious Central Asian food "Lagman". One of my favorite. I recommend this for everyone to try it at least once and you'll see it
author: Nurdin N.

description: We went there last night. The lamb and potatoes were dry and the meat was crusted like it had sat there a long time.  I got two chunks of dry lamb and the rest was potatoes. The spinach mushroom piroska was soggy in places instead of crisp. They do give huge portions though. The carrot salad was quite good. There were also large Asian style dumplings with beef and onions that were cooked on order and served with sour cream.  This was the best option.
author: Two C.

description: I loved their Lagman (noodles with beef and veggie gravy). It was delicious! Can't wait to try other delicious items they had. Great job guys! I am originally from the Central Asia myself and can definitely say that lagman was authentic and tasted great! Plus, if you work in the mall, they would give you a discount - another reason to come back and buy from them. Keep up a great work! Thank you for opening up this food joint and serving great food.
author: Nozima T.

description: Most authentic Kyrgyz food on the west coast hands down. Manti (Kyrgyz dumplings) are hand made and to die for. The authentic way to enjoy them is with spices vinegar. Ask for it. It's free and makes it sooooooo good.
author: Ilias B.

description: Excellent value for the price. $10 gets you a huge meal. Food is tasty and simple- but a little on the heavy side (rice has a lot of butter in it, chicken is cooked in oil). I love their beef stews- I tend to go for the one without potatoes in it as you'll get probably 2x the amount of beef.
author: Gene G.
